display_long_description:
Step into the suffocating blackness of Lethal Ape The Dark, where every echo feels alive and every shadow hides a threat. You move as a gorilla—vaulting, swinging, and pounding the walls with Gorilla Tag’s signature locomotion—yet your primal agility is tested by two inhuman predators that stalk this forsaken realm.

The Lurker drifts just beyond your vision, its featureless form slipping through the darkness without a sound… until your screen goes white in a blinding flash and you’re yanked from your senses. Then there’s The Shrieker, whose sudden, piercing scream ruptures the silent air, sending vibrations through your very bones before it appears at your back with impossible speed.

Rooms twist into impossible corridors, with low ceilings catching your arms as you scramble overhead; cracked floors threaten to betray your position with every footstep. Your breath hitches as you swing from beam to beam, desperately searching for an exit that never comes. Lights flicker overhead, plunging you into deeper night, and you realize there is no safe corner—only more darkness.

Survival depends on split‑second decisions: dart under a fallen girder, leap across a yawning chasm, or risk climbing to higher ground and pray you’re not cut off. But in this realm, courage is a fleeting illusion—and once one of those monsters touches you, your world shatters in a single, soul‑freezing moment. How long can you keep moving before the darkness finally catches you?
